definition: to retreat in defeat
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat

sentences.english: They laughed at retreat afterretreat of the American army.
sentences.chinese: 他們嘲笑美國軍隊一次又一次的敗退。

sentences.english: But the friendship has been brilliant at times after losing ground.
sentences.chinese: 但友情卻一直絢麗在時光節節敗退後。

sentences.english: When the free and easy defeated retreat, the only sensitive to the laughter.
sentences.chinese: 當灑脫潰不成軍節節敗退時，只剩下敏感在狂笑。

sentences.english: The nations that resist that alliance are in retreat.
sentences.chinese: 抵抗這個同盟的國家在節節敗退。

sentences.english: When the rear-guard of his army retreated, the front giving way too.
sentences.chinese: 當他的後衛撤走，前方也在敗退。

sentences.english: The clouds ran across the sky as though in the flight from defeat.
sentences.chinese: 雲陣像敗退似地跑過天空。

definition: Russian army
provisional government
to garrison/to stand guard/on garrison duty
to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
to fight with all one's might
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
iron hoof (of the oppressor)
spy report/intelligence
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
to resist the enemy
powerful enemy
to defect/to betray/to mutiny
the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
